textBeforeTable: Leisure activities In the Land Messin that are located in the stone quarries Jaumont, the golden stone like a ripe fruit that most monuments are made Metz. Career (currently 160 hectares) is used since Roman times, and the stone is now exported to Beirut, Los Angeles and Osaka. Its particularity: it is extremely resistant to weather and frost. Just visit the city to have proof! Moreover, it is an ideal material for sculptors. The wine villages are also to be discovered with their winding streets and steep: St. Ruffin, Jussy, Rozérieulles, Lessy, Scy-Chazelles. I must say that since Roman times, the Moselle region is facing viticulture. The whole area gets Metz and prosperity of the Moselle wine, sang from the fourth century by the poet Ausonius. In the Middle Ages, its quality is excellent, but in the 19th century, the development of the railroad, urbanization are reducing the use of vines. In addition, the phylloxera appeared. The winemakers do not overcome the crisis and the decline of the Moselle wine begins. Today, the wine shows a desire to produce quality (VDQS label) which is again about this wine beyond our borders, and business is booming. In the Country Messin remaining fifteen fortified churches built in the 14th and 15th centuries, which in turn served to protect Metz or attack.
